newsitem.title: USA: IPO HIGHLIGHTS-XLConnect roars at debut.
newsitem.headline: IPO HIGHLIGHTS-XLConnect roars at debut.

text.p: Investors were scrambling to buy shares of XLConnect Solutions Inc, driving the stock up 85 percent to 27-1/4 within the company's first few minutes of public trading on Thursday

The stock rose 12-1/4 to 27 from its initial public offering price of 15. Analysts forecast feverish demand for the company, which makes network products for complex computer and communications systems.
XLConnect had raised its estimated range to $13-$14 a share from its previous estimate of $10 to $12, according to a filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.
XL Connect is a unit of microcomputer company Intelligent Electronics Inc; both are based in Exton, Pennsylvania.
After the offering, Intelligent Electronics would own about 82.1 percent of XL and has said it has no immediate plans to cash out and sell the shares.
Other companies that made their IPO debuts today:
-- DIGEX Inc, a Washington D.C.-based Internet carrier, rose to 12-1/4 from its IPO price of 10-1/8. It offered 4.5 million shares.
Friedman Billings Ramsay was the lead underwriter of the offering.
-- Transkaryotic Therapies Inc shares were trading flat at their IPO price of $15. The company offered 2.5 million shares, which priced at the top of their IPO price range of $13 to $15.

Transkaryotic creates large numbers of therapeutic proteins without cloning genes and inserting them into non-human cell lines, thereby avoiding patented approaches to protein production. It genetically modifies the patients' cells to produce and deliver therapeutic proteins for extended periods of time.
-- Metro Networks surged four to 20 from its IPO price of $16 a share. The company provides traffic reports, local news, sports and weather to the television and radio broadcast industries.
